oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Christmas at the Grand Ole Opry - Hank Snow - Veterans Administration - 1978 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Grand Ole Opry Christmas Special segment from 1978. Featuring Tom Bryant (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), Del Wood (performer), Lonzo & Oscar (performers), Bill Monroe (performer), Porter Wagoner (performer), Skeeter Davis (performer), Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours (performers), President Jimmy Carter and VA Administrator Max Cleland. Broadcast on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Ernest Tubb; Skeeter Davis; Porter Wagoner; Bill Monroe; Texas Troubadours; Del Wood; Lonzo & Oscar
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:28) Tom Bryant introduces Hank Snow -- I'm Movin' On (Hank Snow) -- (03:22) Opening statement (Hank Snow) -- (03:46) Hank Snow introduces Lonzo & Oscar -- (04:00) Lonzo & Oscar joke with the audience and introduces the first tune -- (04:21) Frosty The Defrosted Snowman (Lonzo & Oscar) -- (05:18) Hank Snow talks about the GOO being the oldest radio program in the United States, and talks about some of the GOO members throughout time -- (06:00) Snow introduces Skeeter Davis -- (06:10) Skeeter Davis talks and introduces the next tune -- (06:25) Silent Night (Skeeter Davis) -- (10:08) Snow talks about the Veterans Administration, and introduces President Jimmy Carter -- (10:36) Jimmy Carter talks about and thanks the veterans, and the GOO Christmas Special -- (11:35) Snow introduces Bill Monroe -- (12:04) Bill Monroe talks and introduces the next tune -- (12:18) Christmas Time's A Comin' (Bill Monroe) -- (14:40) Snow talks and introduces the next tune -- (15:03) The Reindeer Boogie (Hank Snow) -- (17:03) Snow talks about singing that song at the opry since the 1950s, and introduces Ernest Tubb -- (17:35) Blue Christmas (Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours) -- (20:25) Snow introduces Del Wood -- (20:38) Christmas medley (Del Wood piano) -- (22:20) Snow talks about George D. Hay, and introduces Porter Wagoner -- (22:55) Happy Birthday Jesus (Porter Wagoner) -- (25:51) Snow wishes a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year, and introduces VA Administrator Max Clelane -- (26:23) Max Clelane thanks Hank, WSM and the GOO, and recites a poem from an unknown veteran soldier -- (28:45) Closing statements (Tom Bryant) -- Closing theme
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand Ole Opry (Radio program); Snow, Hank; Carter, Jimmy, 1924-; Cleland, Max, 1942-; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Texas Troubadours; Davis, Skeeter; Wagoner, Porter; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Lonzo and Oscar; Wood, Del;
